footnotes: An "O" instead of an "x" indicates only clergy and proven devout members of their associated religion may purchase these items

outro.caption: Spellcaster Availability
rows: 1 {@creature Acolyte}. No expendable components available, subtract costs of materials if provided. Roll {@dice d100}; 1-15 is a {@creature Commoner} (either a pious merchant, or a charlatan posing as a healer) instead of an Acolyte; 80-100 is a {@creature Priest} instead of an Acolyte, with additional hit dice and caster level equal to {@dice 1d4-1}.

{@dice 1d4} {@creature acolyte||Acolytes}, and 1 {@creature Priest} with additional hit dice and caster level equal to {@dice 1d4-1}. Expendable components available at a {@chance 25} chance, subtract costs of materials if provided.

{@dice 2d8+3} {@creature acolyte||Acolytes}, and {@dice 1d2} {@creature Priest} with additional hit dice and caster level equal to {@dice 1d6-1}. Expendable components available at a {@chance 55} chance, subtract costs of materials if provided.

{@dice 3d10+2} {@creature acolyte||Acolytes}, and {@dice 1d4} {@creature priest||Priests} with additional hit dice and caster level equal to {@dice 1d6-1}. Expendable components available at a {@chance 75} chance, subtract costs of materials if provided.

table.name: Transportation
intro: {@b Barding –} Armor used to protect an animal. Cost is standard armor cost ×4. See {@table Blacksmith/Armory|5eShopsCatalog|Blacksmithing} and {@table Leatherworker|5eShopsCatalog}. Prices located on pg. 157 of the PHB.

table.name: Jeweler/Stonecutter
intro:
Hard Sell (daily) at 1000 gp (Cheap: 750 gp, Expensive: 1500)
Selling Cap (daily) at 2000 gp (Cheap: 1500 gp, Expensive: 3000 gp)
footnotes: Jewelry with stones already set (including rings, amulets, earrings, etc.), are readily available based on the gemstone availability, at the DM's discretion. Suggestions for gemstone values and descriptions are available in the DMG on {@book page 134|dmg|7|gemstones|1}.

The “Powdering of Gems” service is an as needed task as most places aren’t interested in keeping smashed up gemstones on hand. Some bigger locations may keep a few of the less valuable gems already powdered and bagged, but most places will do it on an as needed basis. {@b More often than not, the customer would need to provide the gem in addition to paying the fee listed in the chart.}

As with all locations, some services may have items not shown typically available on this chart or may offer services not typical for the area. These may come at a higher premium or be a service they only offer as a special reward for a job they need done as well.

{@b Important note} ‘Gem Shop’ prices are based off a system of size vs. price. Gem prices are sold at full size (Default price in the DMG guide located on {@book page 134|dmg|7|gemstones|1}) and as such the price by gem size can be altered to suit your needs.

To use this in an example for spell casting ‘{@spell Chromatic Orb}’ requires ‘A Diamond worth at least 50 gp’ so in this case a default Large Diamond is worth 5000 gp and as such “5000/50=100” so in this case a Small diamond is worth the required 50 gp to cast the spell.

outro.caption: Gemstone Availability
rows: Less than ten {@table 10 gp gemstones}, and a single {@table 50 gp gemstones||50 gp gemstone}
Less than twenty {@table 10 gp gemstones}, less than ten {@table 50 gp gemstones}, and two {@table 100 gp gemstones}

Six of every basic {@table 10 gp gemstones||10 gp gemstone}, less than twenty {@table 50 gp gemstones}, less than ten {@table 100 gp gemstones}, three {@table 500 gp gemstones}, and one gemstone of greater value than 500 gp

Twelve of every basic {@table 10 gp gemstones||10 gp gemstone}, Six of every basic {@table 50 gp gemstones||50 gp gemstone}, less than twenty {@table 100 gp gemstones}, less than ten {@table 500 gp gemstones}, four gemstones of greater value than 500 gp
